title: Well done Riot you've banned players for using Overwolf! What a Joke!!!
body: So riot has been banning people for using Overwolf. Last week I was banned for apparently using 3rd party programs. So I sent my ticket to support asking how as I only have chrome, league, discord and overwolf on my desktop. The reply I got was we are not aloud to discuss it. So basically iv'e been banned for nothing. I asked is Overwolf was legal to use for league. They didn't reply back and just said case is closed... So iv'e been without my account for a week and a half for doing nothing cheers riot you tosses.

replies.body:
Hey there!

Sophie from Overwolf here.
Overwolf will NOT get you banned.

We are working closely with Riot Games to ensure that all the apps we publish are aligned with their Terms of Service and their 3rd party policies. Our apps do nothing more than a second monitor would do for you and do not interact with League of Legends.

> [{quoted}](name=Riot Sargonas,realm=NA,application-id=mNBeEEkI,discussion-id=ao7rYcrT,comment-id=0012,timestamp=2015-03-25T07:17:22.320+0000)
>
> Hey everyone! Just wanted to chime in, since someone asked about our thoughts on this. LoLWiz, in it's current incarnation, is no different from visiting OP.GG or LolNexus or any other similar site. The only real difference is that it is displayed via an Overwolf Plugin, rather than a web page. It's powered by the Riot API, and no questionable access the game client, so as of right now we have no issues with using this app and will not frown upon players who do so.
> 
> That being said, we reserve the right to change our stance on this, if in the future the LoLWiz app adopts any functionality we find to be harmful to player's experience or the game's ecosystem. (Though if that happened we would first attempt reach out to LoLWiz and try to course correct things there, instead of banning players.) Also, naturally, we can never officially condone or promote the use of any third party tool, as we can never guarantee your game stability or safety in doing so.
> 
> TL;DR - It's not directly affecting the client, as it is a component of Overwolf and not a game-mod, so you won't be banned.

> [{quoted}](name=Riot Sargonas,realm=NA,application-id=ZGEFLEUQ,discussion-id=sJia9ty5,comment-id=00020000,timestamp=2016-02-24T23:09:51.311+0000)
>
> Beat me to it. i was going to link to this same post. As outlined above, it's legit to use Overwolf.

Overwolf is trusted by millions of gamers and industry pros like Cloud9, Team Liquid and Logitech Gaming.

Make sure at all time that you are using an Overwolf app by downloading it directly from our appstore available at http://store.overwolf.com/apps/

Given that Riot send out 3rd party software bans in waves and that I have Overwolf running in the background all the time I can pretty much confirm it's not to do with Overwolf, otherwise I *definitely* should have also got banned. It's possible there's something you're not considering about the situation.

Is it a shared computer? Does anyone else use the account? If so, are you *sure* they didn't use something? Is it possible someone gained access to the account and played without your knowledge?
I'm the only one that uses it and no one else has my account! I am 100% sure I didn't use anything but overwolf.

If what your saying is true then keep at it. Push the issue with Support and or get a Rioter to come to the thread and re verify. 

I am currently dealing with the same issue. While I don't think it was Overwolf there isn't many things on my PC that it could have been.
I tried they won't look into it. They don't even explain what I was using or what game or games it was. It's so poor!

The automated detection for 3rd party is by far the most accurate, so assuming you didn't use anything, you'd be much better off looking for signs of compromise on your account, games you didn't play that sort of thing.

What HeartVine says is true. Though to clarify for the people who are unsure, Overwolf will NOT get you banned for 3rd party. That is of course subject to change with any update that Overwolf introduces, if they were to introduce something that was malicious or cheating, but that isn't likely.

HeartVine touched on it, but the most common reasons someone would get a 3rd Party ban without having used any themselves is boosting, account sharing and compromise. If you believe your account was compromised then you need to submit a ticket to Riot saying so, and go through the account recovery process. If this is the case then you will get your account back.

In the case of voluntary account sharing, the responsibility lies with you, and the ban will not be lifted. In the case of boosting the same goes. Boosting alone will get you a 2 week and loss of all ranked rewards for first offense, boosting with scripts is an instant perma.

The official statement is that you use third party programs and custom skins at your own risk, as they are auto detected as malicious by the client and you'll receive a permaban if they are noticed.
At the start of the year Riot announced that this year they will make custom skins fully against the rules (ToS) as a way of cutting out the possibility of people being accidentally permabaned.

It's important to note that Riot does not, and will not discuss how or what they detected.
Doing so reveals too much information and makes it easier for new "hacks" to be developed to be undetectable.
Not to mention if they told you what they detected, it's possible you have another script running that they didn't detect, which would give you invaluable information if you realised they didn't detect that script.

Overall it's your own fault you were banned, and honestly you shouldn't have taken the risk to begin with.

I'm curious how you claim that its his own fault to begin with for using overwolf it has been widely accepted as being ok what 'risk' was there? 

Ontop of that there are many things that count as being a '3rd party program' that you would not even think about.  The fact is things get triggered and Riots process while making it hard for people to figure out which legitimate scripts caused these things, also make it neigh impossible to sort out false positives unless riot finds the fault without the persons help which is rare.. The system has its merits but it has very big flaws also. 

I am not saying the OP is telling the truth and it was overwolf or that he isn't lying. However I am facing a similar situation to him so I am more inclined to believe him when he says he is in fact not cheated weather or not it was overwolf is the question.

Simple check list.

Is it a third party script? Yes or No?

If yes, you deserve to be permabaned, no exceptions as according to the ToS.

There are no "legitimate" scripts, at all.

Seems like you might be taking a heavily one-sided view on this.

Antiweapon is referring to Overwolf specifically which, as far as I know, doesn't provide any kind of scripting software (and is considered as acceptable by Riot's systems [as far as I know, that is]). Based on the information provided in the OP, there's nothing to indicate that StandingTal was using any kind of scripting software, or that it was their fault that this ban was triggered.

That's not to say the might be lying, but it seems as though your comments aren't really helping and are based on a "single-minded" view of the situation, where you believe everyone who get's one of these bans is *definitely* to blame, even though the system itself isn't perfect, and there could be a variety of scenarios that could lead to something like this.

It's just a joke. Like I have spent so much money and time on that account. Like why would I risk my account for the use of 3rd party programs, I wouldn't!  The system is broken and I was just unlucky that I was the one out of millions to be glitched in the system.
Thank you HeartVine, you explained it better then I ever could.
It's okay dude. League is dying, go play Fortnite and Mobile Legends.{{summoner:4}}
yeah riots system is super dodgey, bad luck dude, but thats what happens when you sign the agreement, i wish i never put money into the game, and sucks that you lost any that you did.
